summary: This document is Google LLC's formal response to a Grand Jury Subpoena dated August 26, 2020, issued in the Southern District of New York (20 MAG 9134). It details Google's compliance with the subpoena for account information, provides a certificate of authenticity for produced data, and outlines legal objections to certain aspects of the request, citing the Electronic Communications Privacy Act.

persons.name: Albert Sanchez
persons.role: Google Legal Investigations Support / Records Custodian
persons.context: Google employee who signed the response letter and the Certificate of Authenticity, acting as the custodian of records for the subpoena response.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Google
events.description: A federal grand jury subpoena (Ref. No. 3971083) was issued to Google LLC, compelling the production of documents and information related to a specified Google account(s).

events.title: Google's Subpoena Response and Production
events.description: Google LLC submitted its formal response to the grand jury subpoena, including a letter detailing compliance and objections, a Certificate of Authenticity, and a production of data files with associated hash values.

locations: New York, NY 10278 (Likely the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Google received a federal grand jury subpoena (20 MAG 9134) on August 26, 2020, seeking information related to specific Google account(s).

Google's response, dated September 1, 2020, indicates it produced some responsive information but objected to requests for data from accounts not explicitly identified, citing the Electronic Communications Privacy Act (ECPA) and requiring a court order under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2703(d).

The document includes a Certificate of Authenticity signed by Albert Sanchez, certifying the hash values (MD5 and SHA512) for the produced digital files, ensuring their integrity for legal proceedings.
Google indicated that the identifier(s) provided in the subpoena were not unique and could not be associated with a specific subscriber's account, resulting in no documents for that request.
